Review.Titre: I am a small business owner who has…
Review.Contenu: I am a small business owner who has pretty much felt like he has flushed $3000 down the toilet with my purchase of the LX3000 by Primera. The first few months had all sorts of alignment issues. I finally worked those out and used them sparingly for a year. Maybe 1000 print jobs or less. Now I can't complete a project I need for my little coffee shop cause the prints are coming out of color cause the Printer Head dye cartridge is broken. Tried doing their ghetto procedure of taking out and dabbing it on wet paper towel. Worked for a total of two prints, and then a problem arose again. I should sue Primera in small claims court. These people are Shysters selling a product that is God Awful. I am wasting all the paper and ink printing it with the broken print head and won't get my needed project done before the Holidays. Shame on you Shysters. Watch the video I am posting on YouTube. Search for LX3000 Primera nightmare.

Review.Titre: Our printer has been breaking down…
Review.Contenu: Our printer has been breaking down quite a bit in the year we’ve owned it. This is the 2nd one we had to swap for another printer because of issues. The new printer should have been sent from Primera to us overnight since we rely on the printer to print the labels to sell our products, but it was sent ground which caused many more days of delay in our business productivity.

Review.Titre: We were excited to get our LX3000
Review.Contenu: We were excited to get our LX3000, it was a big investment for us but we wanted the freedom of making our own labels...Nothing but trouble and disappointment! I've spent hours of my life trying to get this hunk of junk to work consistently. It's caused so much stress, like it knows when we have a deadline. - The printer had to be sent back when we first got it, problem with the printhead.- It has trouble reading the ink cartridges- It got very clogged another time (but we were told to leave it on if not using it often so it cleans itself periodically, noted) I gave them one star because their tech support is actually quite good and responsive, maybe they get a lot of practice. It's possible I got a lemon, I know someone who raves about Primera printers. They would not refund my money or send a new one.

Review.Contenu: My order was fine but I installed the new printhead and it still did not print. I chatted online and they were not able to fix. He left and said some one would be in touch. I still have not heard back from anyone and my printer is still not working.

Review.Contenu: Primera is a terrible printer for companies. You can't have one person make labels and one person print them- has to be the same person because Primera is worried someone will use their software with....  not sure why they are worried as if you are using that software you have their printer.

Review.Titre: Prepare for hell if you get the LX2000.
Review.Contenu: We purchased the LX2000 a  couple years back. As soon as it arrived we had issues with the machines reliability, consistency and just over all user experience, which was extremely subpar to other sticker and label machines we have ran and operated. We tried to get refunded, but they insisted it was our machine, so we sent it in and received a new one just to find the same cumbersome issues. We tried to get a refund but they insisted it was too late by that time (conveniently for them right?)  We then  sporadically used the LX2000, even with its time consuming printing setup process (print a test, adjust, print a test, adjust, etc). This setup process can take a long time, waste material and is just a straight up pain. Then additionally, with there high print costs. They use HP print cartridges with chips which the printer will only allow one use of, even though you can easily just refill them and not produce the extra plastic, waste or charge. It was a pain but we persisted using it as we had paid over $3000 for the LX2000. Fast forward to present, we had a small issue with a stuck label, no big deal we thought as its happened 100's of times. However this time after removal of the stuck label, we had issues with our upper & lower label sensors. We called tech support, and after discussion determined it was either another stuck label or the sensors. After confirming that no stuck label was present, we called back to find out that the upper and lower sensors are not available for purchase... that instead you have to purchase the whole feeder, a $650 dollar charge before shipping.  After confirming that the individual sensor parts are "not available" they insisted the only option was to send it in, and have them perform their duties to fix the sensors, but again at the same time consistently claimed they couldn't send me those exact parts that would be used. When I stated our frustration with the time, money and energy put forth the customer service team just simply dismissed me, not caring that I would NEVER purchase anything Primera every again. Which makes it very clear these guys are just simple scam artist who prey on unknowledgeable consumers. They nickel and dime there consumers at every opportunity. Who in their right mind should have to pay hundreds of dollars to have to send in a bulky machine because a label got stuck? How is that even reasonable? Stay away from this company at all costs. This company will waste your money, time and energy. Go elsewhere and avoid headaches.

Review.Titre: Hi need original software for this
Review.Contenu: Hi need original software for this When i bought it 3 years agoIt al all the acces to do everything Now it will let me do 1sticker at the timePlease send feed backThanks

LX3000. Looking for a good compact cost effective printer? I would not be able to recommend the LX3000. We purchased ours in April of 2022. Today on January 29th, 2023 I have been trying to print 200 3.125 x 3.125 BOPP labels for the last four hours. I have less than 20 printed. I have to stand by the machine and press the feed button every 4-labels. I have made several attempts at resets gap sensors and powered unit off/wait/on. To reset gap sensors  labels have to be removed and did as instructed, yet software states labels are still in and at same time states "out of paper". Prints 4 spits out 4 and stops.  We have had nothing but problems. Despite attempts from both sides to work out issues, we are still having problems with every label run.  We use their recommended label provider Hickman Labels. We have gone through 4 printer replacements and 9600 labels printed in the 8 months we have owned the LX3000, we still run into consistent issues.1. Gap Sensor issues: Consistently and on every label run we get gap sensor errors. We go through the reset process, loaf and unload, adjust alignment, reset, power off & on, call support and try to resolve. Sometimes successful, other times not. Spits out and skips massive quantities of labels costing money and time.2. Kraft Label Printing: Cannot print kraft labels without spitting out massive quantities of labels and receiving gap sensor errors throughout the print job of under 100 labels. We had to abandon printing kraft labels to accommodate the printer.3. Service: While the folks are nice and may try to help, I am 50/50 here. We run 7-days per week 7am to 7pm. If we have an issue, we cannot get support in Sundays. Some of the interactions do not result in satisfactory resolution, Some do. I have had contact from top tier and did some good work to help us. Lately though not getting response. Consistently spend hours trying to resolve issues resulting in lost time and production. Strung out on several occasions  shutting down production.6. Labels will peel off on rollers and get stuck. May be a Hickman Label problem but the result is no field serviceable capability on the LX3000 to remove a stuck label. Told by support to try using tweezers, otherwise no way to remove stuck label. Requires stopping production and sending unit for repair. I have two of these that are now unable to be used due to the stuck labels.7. Reviews: When I first had issues I was asked to take down negative review. I did this as I thought the replacement printer would work. Not so, three printers later and still having several issues. Was told by support they have hundreds of LX3000's in field with no issues. Nice to have a supplier make you feel like you are incompetent.All in all I would do a lot more research into the LX3000 before deciding on its purchase. I have learned a lot about label printers as a result of my experience I would look for the following as must haves. Good sensors technology. Ability to print the labels you need. Field serviceable label feeds. 7-days per week support.

Review.Titre: POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE AND TREATMENT
Review.Contenu: I HAVE BEEN A CUSTOMER SINCE I BELIEVE AROUND 2005 WHEN I BOUGHT MY FIRST PRINTER LX810? I HAVE HAD IT ALL THESE YEARS AND HAVE ALWAYS BOUGHT ALL MY SUPPLIES FROM YOU EVER SINCE.  I FINALLY WAS LAID TO REST 2 WEEKS AGO AND I CALLED SPOKE WITH SOMEONE AT PRIMERA TO SEE WHICH WOULD FIT ME AND ASK ABOUT THE REFURBISHED AND HOW QUICK I COULD IT GET AS ALL MY PRODUCTION WAS DONE FOR MY BUSINESS WITHOUT THE PRINTER.  SHE SAID THAT THE SALE OF 8% HAD JUST BEGUN ON THE REFURBISHED SO IF I PLACED MY ORDER RIGHT THEN I COULD HAVE IT OVERNIGHTED. SO I PLACED MY ORDER ON LINE FOR A REFURBISHED PRINTER O#1000805418 $2159.91.  ONCE I RECEIVED MY PRINTER I TRIED TO GET IT TO PRINT AND WAS IMMEDIATELY HAVING PROBLEMS.  IT WAS ONLY PRINTING 1/2 THE COLOR THE OTHER HALF WAS EITHER FADED OR NOTHING AT ALL. I CALL ON THE 31ST AND SPOKE WITH TECH SUPPORT.  I THINK I FIRST TRIED GOING THRU THE CHAT BUT THEN CALLED. ANYWHO, THE PERSON I SPOKE WITH ON TECH SUPPORT WALKED ME THRU MY CLEANING, INSERTED, CLEANING ETC ETC.  NOTHING WORKED.  I ALREADY USED THE INK THAT CAME WITH IT AND THEN USED THE ADDL ONE I PURCHASED AT THE SAME TIME AS I THOUGHT MAYBE IT WAS THE INK?? THE TECH SUPPORT GUY SAID HE WOULD HAVE TO OVERNIGHT ME AN INK CARTRIDGE FIRST TO SEE IF IT WAS INFACT THE INK AND IF THAT WAS NOT THE PROBLEM I WOULD HAVE A NEW PRINTER OVERNIGHTED.  WELL INK CAME THE NEXT DAY AND DID NOT WORK SO I CALLED BACK AND SPOKE WITH BRENTLEY WALTERS IN TECH SUPPORT.  I HAVE TO SAY I WAS NOT NICE THE FIRST TIME AND THEN NOW THIS CALL I GOT VERY ANGRY BECAUSE BRENTLY TOLD ME THAT WAS NOT HOW THE PROCESS WORKED AND THAT I WOULD HAVE TO PURCHASE THE $600 2 YEAR EXT WARRANTY IN ORDER TO HAVE A PRINTER SHIPPED OVERNIGHT TO ME OTHERWISE I WOULD HAVE TO SEND IN MY PRINTER FOR REPAIR????!!! KEEP IN MIND THE PRINTER CAME TO MY DOORSTEP DEFECTIVE!!!!!!! I WAS FURIOUS I EXPLAINED THAT MY BUSINESS WAS PRACTICALLY SHUT DOWN BECAUSE OF THIS AND YES I WAS VERY ANGRY.  HE MADE ME GO ON LINE AND PAY FOR THE EXT WARRANT o#1000809777 TO VERBALLY GIVE HIM THE ORDER NUMBER AND MY NEW PRINTER WOULD BE SHIPPED OUT OVERNIGHT.  WELL NEXT COMES AROUND I WAITED ALL DAY UNTIL 5PM AND WENT ONTO PRIMERA TO CHECK THE TRACKING AND GUESS WHAT THE ORDER HAD BEEN CANCELED!!!!!!! NOW I AM VERY VERY ANGRY.  I CALL BACK AND TECH SUPPORT INFORMS ME THAT PRIMERA DOES NOT SELL REFURBISHED PRINTERS ONLY NEW.  I TOLD HIM HE WAS CRAZY AND HE NEEDED TO KNOW THE WEBSITE AND GAVE HIM THE ORDER #.  AGAIN, NOW IM TOLD THAT I WAS NOT ABLE TO PURCHASE AN EXT WARRANTY ON A REFURBISHED AND THAT I WOULD STILL HAVE TO SEND MY PRINTER IN FOR REPAIR.  I WAS VERY VERY HOT.  I TOLD HIM I WANTED TO SPEAK TO A SUPERVISOR AND THEN I WAS SENT TO RICHIE GRIFFITHS.  HE EXPLAINED TO ME AGAIN THAT HE WAS SORRY AND IF I GOT THE PRINTER TO FEDEX AND SENT A PICTURE OF IT AND TRACKING TO HIM I WOULD GET MY PRINTER IN MY HANDS TODAY AS IT WOULD BE OVERNIGHTED!!!!  WELL I SENT PICTURES TO HIM AROUND 10AMEST AND EMAILED AND SAID IT WAS GOING OUT. THOUGHT ALL WAS GOING TO BE GOOD UNTIL WENT ONTO TRACKING WITH FEDEX AND IT SHOWS THAT THE PRINTER WILL NOT BE DELIVERED UNTIL MONDAY!!! I HAVE NEVER NEVER NEVER BEEN MORE DISAPPOINTED WITH THE WAY I HAVE BEEN TREATED AND LACK OF CARE FOR ME AS A SMALL BUSINESS OWNER.  I EVEN TOLD RICHIED YESTERDAY I WOULD RATHER ORDER ONLINE A BRAND NEW ONE YESTERDAY AND PAY THE FEDEX OVERNIGHT TO HAVE IT HEAR TODAY AND RETURN THIS PIECE OF CRAP THAN TO WAIT ANOTHER DAY WITHOUT MY PRINTER.  HE ASSURED ME THAT I WOULD HAVE MY PRINTER TODAY, WHICH AGAIN WAS A LIE.  I WILL NEVER RECOMMEND YOUR COMPANY FOR ANY PRINTERS IN THE FUTURE AS I HAVE ALWAYS GAVE GREAT RECOMMENDATIONS FOR YOUR COMPANY BUT AFTER THIS I WILL NOT.

Our contact info was on our PO as well as our email but they never even attempted to contact us. Turns out they lost our credit card number so they never finalized the order.

Review.Titre: We constantly have to send our printer…

Review.Titre: LX610- Not for custom cosmetic labels.
Review.Contenu: I was asked to remove my review to give them a chance to make things right. I did that and they did not do well. I'm sure this is great for some people. But what they don't tell you is that you have to spend more money on a laminate process to have waterproof cosmetic labels. But even then, the laminate only comes in specific size formats. If you need custom sizes they send you to a third party to have a custom set made, which increases the cost even more. They have a clear label, but they will not send a sample to test. They expect you to spend the $255 on the full 2 rolls. This is a giant paper weight for us and can not be used. Also, they refuse to take it back even though there is nothing wrong with the machine. We were just sold wrongly on how it would benefit us. We will not be doing business with Primera Tech in the future. Make sure you ask EVERY question you need and then some before purchasing the LX610.

Review.Titre: The products are very good
Review.Contenu: The products are very good. But the ordering process is a disaster. During the ordering process (Germany) only Amazon Pay was offered and it took us 15 minutes to process the order via PayPal.

Review.Titre: I ran about 100 labels through my…
Review.Contenu: I ran about 100 labels through my printer and 2 of the labels got stuck in the printer, making the printer useless. Only after calling tech support did I learn that my printer would have to be mailed back to the company for repair. After 100 labels!!!!

Review.Titre: Took about two weeks to actually place…
Review.Contenu: Took about two weeks to actually place the order.  Every customer service person I spoke to had a different answer for the same questions.  Seemed they only wanted to get off the phone.  People are not trained well and very inconsistent.  Info given was consistently wrong.

Review.Titre: poor customer service
Review.Contenu: Customer service dropped the ball with entering my order. I am on automatic cc payment so as not to delay my shipment yet I find out today they did not ship because they could not find payment information which is never an issue 9 out of 10 times.

Review.Titre: Terrible experience
Review.Contenu: Terrible experience.  Not knowledgeable about their products at all. They sold us printers claiming they could do things that they could not.  Also led us in the wrong direction about labels and when timing marks were and were not needed.  I would not recommend working with Primera to anyone.

Review.Titre: I ordered PTcreate PRO and my order is…
Review.Contenu: I ordered PTcreate PRO and my order is on hold.  I don't understand why that is not automatic like all software purchases.  Why do I need to wait until someone from the company gets to work before I can my authorization key for the software?

Review.Titre: Poor print quality
Review.Contenu: Poor print quality, prints grey not black upon receiving email from primera, kindly stated its not the printer for us... maybe we needed a step up. 2 days later,  no one has contacted me but I keep receiving automated emails about wonderful customer service 🤣

Review.Titre: Sales representative disappear for…
Review.Contenu: Sales representative disappear for weeks after negotiating P.O. New sales rep did not honor previouly agreed discount, promised to sent quotation in 1 hour, I gave up after one full day and order from website the next day.

Review.Titre: Unit was back ordered and I was never notified
Review.Contenu: Said they had refurbished units in stock that would ship in 3-5 days. Received no further communication. When I followed up over a week later, it was back ordered with no ETA. How no one contacted me to let me know they didn't have the unit in stock is beyond me.

Review.Titre: You computer system
Review.Contenu: You computer systemWas not functioning properly and it delayed my order but the people who helped me were friendly. It’s just that you seem to require on line ordering for custom labels and when your website is down this www frustrating

Review.Titre: It didn’t work
Review.Contenu: It never worked, we called customer service about 5x and we also called the place where we bought it from and nobody was able to help us. We bought every app that we were told Buy and nothing worked. Very upset about this product

Review.Titre: I purchased the LX610 and have had…
Review.Contenu: I purchased the LX610 and have had issues from the beginning.  I was using a Mac and was told by a tech support person that this printer works better with a PC and that is the only way to clean the cutter appropriately.  After the 1st printer I received had to be sent back and replaced I have had to call numerous times.  My colors do not print true to what is on screen and I was told they could not help me.  I recently to sent the printer back for a stuck label and was told I had to pay for shipping and $350 service charge.  It has been slightly over a year and I complained so they waived the service fee (thanks), however when I told them I was a business and needed the printer asap I was told they were doing me a favor and they would not expedite my ticket!  Stick with an expensive piece of crap printer.  Was also told there were no issues with this printer however looking into the reviews that is a lie!  It does not have good reviews and there are issues!!!

Review.Titre: I am still waiting for my printer
Review.Contenu: I am still waiting for my printer.  I received a faulty one, lost sales in the interim and have yet to see a tracking number.  Three hours with customer service, while they were nice, nothing was accomplished.  $3300 for nothing

Review.Titre: I had to pay for parts for a unit that…
Review.Contenu: I had to pay for parts for a unit that us under warranty.  After 40 minutes on the phone, I found out that the part was $4.99.  Complete waste of my time.  And now your follow up is some email?????  You've lost a customer

Review.Titre: We have more problems with our Primera…
Review.Contenu: We have more problems with our Primera Printer than every other piece of equipment in our shop combined. Solutions usually involved changing half-full cartridges or replacing print heads that are still at 70%

Review.Titre: I cannot check out of the website for…
Review.Contenu: I cannot check out of the website for the last 4 months now. There is a glitch in the shopping cart page. I have had to call and place an order by phone for 4 months and it is very inconvenient. Please fix immediately.

Review.Titre: Terrible experience
Review.Contenu: I placed an order for parts for my printer and ordered it with two day shipping. There website claims if you place the order after 2pm it will ship the next business day. After 5 days and four different conversations with their employees they tell me it has finally shipped. After complaining about this they tell me I can go ask fed ex about the problem. I heard the fed ex tracking number is wrong, the item is on back order, and go ask fed ex why it was late from this company. After all of that no one offers a refund on shipping, or partial discount, no apologies or anything. Terrible company, horrible customer service, and my company will never use them again for our products. Buy at your own risk because if you ever have a part break you will be out of service for a while and their customer service is horrible.

Review.Titre: I waited two weeks to get the…
Review.Contenu: I waited two weeks to get the replacement ink cartridges.One of the cartridges, Cyan s3601 was bad, I replaced it with the second cartridge, it works. How do I get a replacement for the bad cartridge?

Review.Titre: I had made RMA/warranty service…
Review.Contenu: I had made RMA/warranty service request. Sent my printer for repair and get the printer back without anyone even opening the box. The printer was not repaired. No explanation from Tech department.

Review.Titre: I call in and get a live "Tech"
Review.Contenu: I call in and get a live "Tech". I said "I have a new black cartridge in my Bravo Pro. Yesterday it showed 98%. After running 10 CD's it shows empty". His SOLUTION? Replace the NEW cartridge with another NEW cartridge. That should keep you guys in the cartridge business! The next day the machine totally quit communicating with my computer. I sent a chat after hours on Friday explaining my situation. Your chat box came back "we are closed but some one will call you on Monday morning". Well this is Friday of that same week. No call! Machine is totally dead. In the meantime, sure enough I ordered new ink, black and colored. Thanx for your spectacular 'tech support' for a non-working machine!

Review.Titre: I am very disappointed
Review.Contenu: I am very disappointed.  We purchased a2 generation upgrade expecting a significant productivity and connectivity improvement.  Did not happen.  Tech support has been mediocre.  Must be our fault.

Review.Titre: Ink purchased directly from Primera and…
Review.Contenu: Ink purchased directly from Primera and labeled for our printer threw "Incompatible Ink Installed" error. All the issues until now have been annoying, this one is costing us revenue.

Review.Titre: Terrible product and customer service
Review.Contenu: I bought this Impressa IP60 4 months ago and it kept saying it was a backorder. I canceled the order after a month and 3 months later I found the machine on my porch. I found the machine doesn't work and the customer service seem to act like they have no concern for the product. After getting the machine the paper will not go through the roller, I spent an hour with customer service and they couldn't fix it. I tried to return it and I was told you had to hold $1000 for me to return it. And I had to go through a process for approval to get my money back. Now my question is why do I need to get approval for a product that doesn't work? So, now it's going on for 5 months without a machine. And they say they're the number 1 company with these machines and have great customer service.

Review.Titre: If you are looking to print high…
Review.Contenu: If you are looking to print high quality, water resistant labels this is not the machine for you. The quality of the labels pale in comparison to outsourcing to professional printers. YOU WILL NOT SAVE MONEY BY USING THIS FOR YOUR IN-HOUSE PRINT NEEDS. We thought this would be our savior but it wound up costing us an arm and a leg and a few wholesale accounts. You will burn through tons of bad test labels every time you run a job, even more if you are switching out label sizes often. Beware of the labels and ink you buy, Primera will knowingly sell you ink and labels that are not compatible. We’ve tried combos of the dye and the pigment with glossy paper labels & extreme tuff matte labels and they all had issues with either smearing, discoloration over time, and over dullness in print quality.

Review.Titre: Just rubbish avoid
Review.Contenu: We have low use of a label printer (max 50 prints a week) and the recommended lite software is beyond dire . Crashes more than it works , just rubbish

Review.Titre: I have been a customer of Primera for…
Review.Contenu: I have been a customer of Primera for many years and recently I was told that Primera will stop supplies for the fx and cx 1200, so know what? Very disappointed....

Review.Titre: I ordered the Primera LX2000 ink when I…
Review.Contenu: I ordered the Primera LX2000 ink when I asked to process payment with Amazon it switched to the wrong ink while processing payment.

Review.Titre: Product did not perform as sold
Review.Contenu: Product did not perform as sold. After numerous hours working with salesperson and tech support we were told there was nothing more they could do to assist.

Review.Titre: This is the most unfriendly website I…
Review.Contenu: This is the most unfriendly website I love design I think you should have a look and re-launch your website and please disable go to language Transfer

Review.Titre: problems with product
Review.Contenu: It didn’t give me any information on why my printer is printing lines in my photos. I’m terribly disappointed in service. It’s harming my photo business.

Review.Titre: DO NOT BUY
Review.Contenu: absolutely insane that only these rolls work for the printer. makes you spend a ridiculous amount of money on labels and blades causing so much waste.

Review.Titre: The person I was talking with was good
Review.Contenu: The person I was talking with was good, but gave me wrong advise that cost me 79.00!  They need to be more knowledgeable to avoid giving the wrong solution.

Review.Titre: What a joke. Everything from the printer programming to labels to the ink.
Review.Contenu: This is life with a Primera label printer:Step 1. load label roll. -3 labels for the glue on the roll itself. -1 more once it loads. Step 2. Load ink cartridge. -1 to -2 labels every time you do this as the printer is programmed to spit out a blank label when the cartridge is changed. If you fail to use your printer every 3 days, the ink cartridge dries out. You must then manually rehydrate it as per their support team's directions. Again losing 2 to 3 labels to get this to work properly again. Once the ink gets down to 30-40% it frequently just stops working entirely & when it's at 0% it's often just a programming scam to get you to order more ink because it'll print another 30-50 labels in full color, but not when it's at 50% apparently. Absolutely terrible, pull your hair out trouble shooting every time you use it. Should've bought the other brand, deeply regretting it.

Review.Titre: The inability to work with a MacBook…
Review.Contenu: The inability to work with a MacBook Pro, require a USB adapter and according to your own support the lx500 can’t work with an adapter is ridiculous.

Review.Titre: Doesn't print from Adobe nor Corel files anymore
Review.Contenu: I have a Primera LX2000 printers and after initial problems and having to have it sent back and replaced, things worked well for a few months.  We use current versions of Adobe Illustrator and Corel Draw, and had been printing from them all along. Now we can't print from either, and tech support can't get it working and say its Adobe and Corel problems. say we need to use Bartender software work around. Hmmm worked for months. We have tremendous numbers of files that have been designed for this printer, and a small fortune in labels. They won't fix the issue! So upset about cavalier attitude of their tech support since we purchased these. Do your self a favor and look at the Epson comparable. Work's with the main graphic software's, faster and more affordable consumables. Don't risk your business future on a company that does not support its customers and it's current products! Happy to discuss with anyone considering this printer.

Review.Titre: I have not received the product
Ink cost is insane do not buy.
Review.Contenu: Love the printer what I don't like is the fact they relable hp ink cartridges and then chip them to make massive profits on the printer.

Review.Titre: We were billed 3 times for the same…
Review.Contenu: We were billed 3 times for the same order  we have called to to resolve and awaiting for a call back - please call us ASAP - 727.729.2715

Review.Titre: LX400 color label printer
Review.Contenu: We own the LX400 color label printer.  It was sold to us as being good for product labels.  That was not accurate - the ink smears if it even remotely touches any form of water or condensation.  If you are running different labels at different times, it constantly advances a label so that you are wasting so many labels instead of it printing on the first available label. The software for designing the labels is not user friendly or intuitive either.  I do not recommend this product.  I've expressed these concerns to Primera and they have offered an upgrade that of course, we would pay for.  I'm not willing to spend more money and not have my problems solved.  No reimbursement has been offered for the wasted labels.Thank you for your response.  We order BOPP labels and I turn down the ink saturation.  Both of those options have been provided over the phone and I currently do both - not with the success I had hoped.  When this machine was demo-ed for us, it had beautiful multi-color labels, not barcodes.

Review.Titre: I have replaced the printer 3 times and…
Review.Contenu: I have replaced the printer 3 times and none of them work functionally

Review.Titre: DHL subcontracted the delivery to colis…
Review.Contenu: DHL subcontracted the delivery to colis prive. The driver did not show up and dropped the parcel 20 miles away from us. Our complains were dismissed. This does not happen with other services like UPS or Fedex.

Review.Titre: The Primera Support is horrible
Review.Contenu: The Primera Support is horrible.  They continue to give me fixes for my LX500c Color Label Printer and nothing works.  I continue to have to unclog the thing, wasting labels and "ink".  And I still can't get a correct picture.

Review.Titre: The last two purchases was wrong by the…
Review.Contenu: The last two purchases was wrong by the support team

Review.Titre: Missing parts
Review.Contenu: I ordered a printer and it was missing a part , I was told it would arrive in the next 3 days because I had an event  , 15 days later I had to follow up cause I never got my part . When I spoke w customer service again they said they were going to send it out since the first time they were having issues  and should arrive in the next couple of days , same story from the first time , We will see how it goes .

Review.Titre: I have had error codes at pointing…
Review.Contenu: I have had error codes at pointing toward defective replacement ink cartridges. Replaced by Primera. I asked the technician in my chat, why the cartridges were repeatedly defective. My concern is the possibility that the problem may also involve my printer's operation. I was directed to receive another replacement, and if the problem continued perhaps the printer itself could be diagnosed via the chat. Its great that the replacements are provided, but if the same issues persist, at what point does the technician get involved with investigating another cause?

Review.Titre: Long delays between messages
Review.Contenu: Long delays between messages - never responded during remote request to reboot. Finally gave up and rebooted without instructions for reconnect. In general, unhappy with the glitchy nature of the LX610 and wish I could return it.

Review.Titre: Ink cartridge are poor quality
Review.Contenu: Still have not gotten my replacement ink cartridge and keep having problems with the cartridges not performing correctly.  That’s right they don’t work all the time.

Review.Titre: This printer cost thousands of dollars…
Review.Contenu: This printer cost thousands of dollars and is used very little, yet it seems to break down annually costing alot more money. This time $700!I wonder what is next?It hasn't stopped breaking down since we bought it.

Review.Titre: Shipping was VERY expensive
Review.Contenu: Shipping was VERY expensive, and more that it needed to be. $14 to ship a 3 oz package FedEx, when you could have shipped it US First Class, with tracking, for just over $4.00

Review.Titre: I am attempting to reorder a custom…
Review.Contenu: I am attempting to reorder a custom product and getting no help with this sent an email on the 15th and got no response

Review.Titre: Disappointed-lots of down time
Review.Contenu: This unit prints beautiful labels when it works. We have had so many issues with the machine and now parts are just falling off. We have spent more time with support on this model than should be necessary. Bad ink heads sent back multiple times. Very disappointed  with this model and it came highly recommended and we waited over 6 months to get it. Now parts are just falling out of the print head area. We have had so much costly down time. Unit should be replaced.

Review.Titre: Great service with some product reservations...
Review.Contenu: Service wise, I have to give to them,  on time as always. Order products after hours for an event within a few days and was received within two days without delays. Primera has never let me down. On the other hand,  the paper rolls ordered were a big letdown. At the event,  with customers lining up for prints, the IP60 printer could not receive the rolled paper ordered. I had to forced the roll into the slots then prey out to remove. Luckily the printer performance was not effected but over time it is a concern.

Review.Titre: The issue that the Printer was…
Review.Contenu: The issue that the Printer was originally sent in for has been resolved. However, the QA on the printer does not seem to have been very thorough. The metal bar that slides the finished cassettes to the side does not work. It makes a grinding noise whenever a cassette is printed and does not come out. The Printer is also having connectivity issues with our PTLAB program. It is not recognizing the Printer.

Review.Titre: Ink problems
Review.Contenu: Ink problemsI did not have a problem with customer service, they were helpful.  However, I am just frustrated with the printer in general.  We have had nothing but problems with it since we bought it - and in my opinion - it is too expensive to be having so many issues.

Review.Titre: I received my Primera LX610 printer…
Review.Contenu: I received my Primera LX610 printer today. Was excited to open it and try it out. Once I open the package, and had it all set up. I thought I was missing something no labels to print. I called customer service and they told me it does not come with any. I never heard of a machine not coming with at least some sample labels. I paid $2,800 for a machine I cannot used. I told it would of been nice to have that stated clearly that you need to buy labels. Disappointed that I have to wait now.  I order labels but now need to wait till they arrive. Not a good way to start my experience with a new printer.

Review.Titre: I found it very difficult to enter a…
Review.Contenu: I found it very difficult to enter a custom order on the website. I contacted the sales team three times via their chat feature and all three times I was told I had to enter the order myself on line.  Certainly a lack of customer service and unless you are ordering a standard product I would not recommend.

Review.Titre: Hello!
Review.Contenu: Hello!Today, I purchased (Oder # 1000446913) the software printer driver for an LX610 (MAC Version). I received purchase confirmation and a copy of my PAID receipt but no Software Activation Key. NOT GOOD, customer satisfaction and service. The Software Activation Key must be sent immediately.César F Castro

Review.Titre: Nothing but problems since i received…
Review.Contenu: Nothing but problems since i received my printer last Wednesday. bad ink, bad media chip, a week later, new media chip waiting for manager approval.  I am without chip to use my roll of labels. I was told it was sent out last week.  Very disappointed

Review.Titre: Needs to come with at least some labels!!
Review.Contenu: The initial purchasing process was simple and easy. But, our printer did arrive late; Also we were unable to put it to use right away due to the fact that it did not come with any label paper of any kind, nor were we informed of that fact at any point before, during, or after purchasing. Possibly consider at least putting in a foot or two of labels for customers to use for test printing. And that detail seriously needs to be added to the product description: does not come with labels! It is great that at least there is some ink included though, so thank you for that.

Review.Titre: Still not working because of poor communication
Review.Contenu: I sent it in and for what ever reason it took almost 2 weeks after it was repaired to get it back to me.  I had sent the print head with it so I assumed that the repair person had used that print head to test everything.  When I hooked it up and tried to print nothing came out, not a drop.  If it needed a new print head then why didn't they send one with it and charge me.  So now I ordered a new print head.  Very poor communication from Primera.

Review.Titre: Very disappointed that the…
Review.Contenu: Very disappointed that the brochure/software included with the printer was outdated... Only a call to customer support (TOTALLY unnecessary!) revealed, after 3 straight days of conversations, that the software that came with the printer AND the updated software on  your website, was totally useless for my iMac 27" running on Catalina OS!  Now I have to WAIT until your company comes up with a solution... I don't think I can hold my breath that long!

Review.Titre: I had such high hopes for this label…
Review.Contenu: I had such high hopes for this label printing system- the LX500c, but unfortunately, the ink is quite high priced for as fast as it goes.  I am quite happy with the end product labels but I just don't think long term I'll be able to sustain use of it in my business.  I contacted customer service about a bulk discount- which amounted to very little & you must purchase a case of 48!

Review.Titre: terrible communication,bad info
Review.Contenu: terrible communication,bad info , asked for an amended invoice still don`t have it, i was told i could send a check then i was told i had to wait until it cleared,paid $40 to overnight the check, could have sent a cashiers check or bank check was told they didn`t accept them, had to call 3 times just to find out what was going on, it was just a mess,no one seemed to know what the hell the procedure was.

Review.Titre: Not very happy!!!
Review.Contenu: I placed order at 12:30 on a Friday and didn’t receive order placed until the following Monday... then I was told if I didn’t pay the $50 faster freight charge it would take a month... so I told them I would go ahead and pay because I’m in need ASAP... so for $50 then they tell me I can get it in hopefully two weeks which I feel is ridiculous... on top of it they charged me 100 so I called and they said they would remove the other $50 they added on!!! So in my personal experience it wassnt great!!!!

Review.Titre: Primera seems a shadow of itself these days
Review.Contenu: I always thought that Primera was a good company, but these days when I call for help with something that I cannot resolve on their website, I just get some guy with marbles in his mouth who tells me to go to the website. In short, I can't get the help I was after, and need to go elsewhere.

Review.Titre: Difficult for special orders
Review.Contenu: I have been ordering custom labels for years but the new website is very difficult and confusing for placing special orders.My order came through wrong but fortunately there was a good customer support person who spotted it and contacted me to correct.5 stars for customer service 2 stars for the new website

Review.Titre: The first tech I spoke with a few weeks…
Review.Contenu: The first tech I spoke with a few weeks ago said I needed an entire print carriage at a cost of over $125. I ordered it and was sent. Not only was it the wrong part for my Bravo se, it turns out, after speaking with a different tech, I only needed a $5 dollar replacement part. It was sent and works fine.      I had to pay the $22 in return shipping costs even it was Primera's fault for sending me the wrong part!

Review.Titre: Website seems to change monthly
Review.Contenu: Website seems to change monthly. Very difficult to navigate. Not user friendly as you must start over from the home page every time you need to add another item to your cart. Prices are expensive and they are the only ones you can purchase from if you have their printer. I have reached out to them about this in the past and it has changed nothing.

Review.Titre: Please provide other shipping options!
Review.Contenu: All I needed were two springs that were less than one dollar total. Shipping charges were going to be close to $13 because they only shipped FedEx. The only Reason I did place an order was because they were the only provider for the spring. I had to add other items in order to justify the shipping. Please offer other shipping options then FedEx only.

Review.Titre: The new website: thumbs down!
Review.Contenu: The new website was really wonky to use.  Too many annoying popups cluttered the screen and obstructed my trying to get to my order history.  I intensely dislike the non-choice of having to accept Cookies in order to get rid of that banner and am not interested in having my shopping experience "enhanced" by having even more intrusive tracking to intrude in my emails.It took several attempts to get what I wanted to order because of all the screen clutter not allowing me to select my products. It was so frustating, that had it not been too late, I would have closed out and just called an order in over the phone.  Your old site was much easier to use.

Review.Titre: Not the best value
Review.Contenu: Power receptacle is loose, lid is flimsy, does not calibrate well enough to print to edge consistently, labels rolls leave glue on label, have to upgrade software to cut and paste... Just not a good value. We would return but need it too much. We just worked around all of the challenges.

Review.Titre: AT 9.15 AM I ORDERED and paid for next…
Review.Contenu: AT 9.15 AM I ORDERED and paid for next day air because the areaonl9ine said that that if ordered before noon it would go out same day.  It never got shipped and I paid for the next day air. When I called no one said what I though they should have said which is to credit back the next day air cost of $121.00.Instead they offered a free set of ink cartridges which  were not sent so I am disappointed in the customer service i was given. My call trying to get my freight reduced ,took 45 minutes to an hour. Way to long

Review.Titre: An unusually difficult experience.
Review.Contenu: We have always had great service from Primera but when we recently reported a defective role of labels using the live chat option, the experience was frustrating and ultimately led to an unresolved problem.

Review.Titre: i called twice to place order i had to…
Review.Contenu: i called twice to place order i had to put down the phone they could not pull out my sea   y accountthen i did order under my new company but when i called to say that should not tax my payment the lady made it complicated so end it paying extra $35 for taxes

Review.Titre: bottle labeler did not work for our…
Review.Contenu: bottle labeler did not work for our application despite being in spec (1" 50ml bottle) and tech support was a joke when we called in for support, essentially saying that our bottle probably would not work in the labeler consistently despite it being within the range.  Very disappointed.

Review.Titre: Way more $ and trouble than its worth!
Review.Contenu: I purchased a refurbished LX2000. The printer is capable of producing beautiful labels...when its actually working. I had to send the LX2000 off for repair the first day I received it. The second LX2000 stopped working several months later. I sent the second printer off to be repaired. I was charged $350 plus shipping. Oh, and over $50 for a cardboard box to ship the printer in. A little over 2 weeks later I received the second repaired printer. So far it is working about 80% of the time. It quits periodically, so I have to turn it off and back on again.

Review.Titre: Using the printer is a routine point of frustration and source of profanity.
Review.Contenu: Printers seem designed to waste as many labels as possible while the ink cartridges commonly malfunction if not used more than once a week at a minimum.Using the printer is a routine point of frustration and source of profanity. When it works the labels are good enough.

Review.Titre: It says "IN STOCK ITEMS ORDERED BEFORE…
Review.Contenu: It says "IN STOCK ITEMS ORDERED BEFORE 2:00 PM (CST, -5 GMT) TO SHIP TODAY", my item is in stock and it's been 48h since I placed the order, still not shipped.

Review.Titre: NOT USER FRIENDLY
Review.Contenu: I bought the LX500C from Amazon because they make returns so easy, unfortunately by the time I realized the printer was so un user friendly it was too late to return, the labels I bought at the same time that said they were for this printer were too big so I ordered directly from Primera and they just won't match up with what I'm printer. I was under the impression from discription the bar tender was more user friendly and could "create" documents, it doesn't and when I called for assistance the Primera tech I spoke to was very rude and degrading. I was hoping to find an easy solution to making labels for our coffee bags and it has been nothing but frustration.

Review.Titre: Lack of communication between…
Review.Contenu: Lack of communication between departments, transferred multiple times between departments. Don't see why the tech can't just help me order the part I need, rather than bouncing back and forth between tech and sales. Still ended up receiving the wrong part.

Review.Titre: Honestly, not great.
Review.Contenu: Honestly, after one year of use I conclude that this printer is very wonky, not accurate (lots of label-loss due to faulty alignment and cheapness of design) AND the ink issues make for expensive labels. Quite a wasteful machine in fact.

Review.Titre: Unresolved repair issue
Review.Contenu: I bought a Primera Bravo SE a few years back and the machine has worked well up until a point.  At that point, the burner drive malfunctioned and I was unable to resolve the issue with a driver update.  So I contacted Primera to initiate a non warranty repair of the unit.  I paid the $400 flat fee and shipped the unit to their repair facility.  When I received the unit back, the unit still worked as if no repair was conducted.  I tried several attempts to resolve the issue with their technical support staff, to no avail and the unit now only functions as a disk printer and not as the publisher that I purchased.  Very disappointed.

Review.Titre: We have long had problems with Primera…
Review.Contenu: We have long had problems with Primera printers -- they work for a while and then go bad. As a small business owner, most of my time is spent solving problems, and the biggest problem I have, without questions, is my Primera printer.

Review.Titre: Primera Video Shows How to Remove a Stuck Label
Review.Contenu: Revised 8/23/2022. I removed the link as requested by Primera. Now, a cautionary tale. Wouldn't you know another label got stuck in the feeder. The second time we took the LX2000 apart did not go as well. A tiny screw got away and landed where we could not retrieve it. This messed up the printer. So, I shipped it to Primera for $650 and am crossing my fingers it can be repaired.I contacted support because a label came off the backing and got stuck under the feeder. I was looking for instructions on how to remove the stuck label.Tech support recommended either sending me a service manual or shipping the LX2000 in for servicing, costing $650, not including shipping. I chose the service manual. The manual was complicated and not very helpful. I searched YouTube hoping someone else had this issue. I found a video by Primera showing how to remove a stuck label on the LX2000. I followed the directions on the video and successfully removed the label. I recommend tech support have a reference list of Primera's videos to offer the customer.

Review.Titre: We are a company that orders…LABEL STOCK
Review.Contenu: We are a company that orders semi-frequent, and all stock for our LX2000 is custom.  Prices went up without any explanation to us, and we were forced to complete the order.  Looking at our options from this point forward, thanks.

Review.Titre: Would not buy again
Review.Contenu: The sales staff will tell you all the good things about the printer when you are you looking to buy one but they won't tell you that you are pretty much on your own when if comes to after sales questions or tech support.

Review.Titre: I had 10 defective ink cartridges to…
Review.Contenu: I had 10 defective ink cartridges to send back, and I've had to pay for more cartridges to cover me until the new ones arrive, which Primera states takes a long time on their website.

Review.Titre: The Power supply unit on our 4100x unit…
Review.Contenu: The Power supply unit on our 4100x unit failed, we contacted support for the appropriate replacement part number.  Transferred to sales to ensure the part was in stock and ready to ship today.  This was all before 2:00PM EST, at 5:16PM after we closed, received email stating PSU was no longer available and the replacement "It is not a direct replacement though as it is 200w instead of 300w, it's not auto-switching and it doesn’t have a physical on/off switch. It will fit and power the unit though." Customer Service only response is "Looks like we will need to get everyone updated on the status of the original SKU you ordered."  After talking with 3 people and explaining the urgency of the problem.  It's nice to know one thing on the internet is absolutely correct "Customer service is a dead concept".

Review.Titre: I am not willing to share any more…
Review.Contenu: I am not willing to share any more details because the last time I did I was attacked on social media by someone at Primerica saying that any issues I had were my fault because I hadn’t been to their school

Review.Titre: Primer -eh..
Review.Contenu: Most companies do follow ups and have strong IT support - Not Primera.  we only hear from them when we contact them, and each time we have an issue, it seems the last person that we left off with has left the company.

Review.Titre: I feel like I wasted my money
Review.Contenu: I feel like I wasted my money. The $3000 printer that I bought to cut out labels does not cut out unless you buy the $130 sub-par software that is required for the printer to do it's job. Even worse, the software frequently crashes, and when it does work it re-arranges my designs entirely for ai, svg, psd, and pdf files. The only viable way to print with it is when you just plop a .png or .jpg file  on it but that sucks too because the print always comes out faded. The only upside to this purchase is saving pennies per label, but is it really worth it when the quality is so much worse? I might just go back to ordering labels from Avery or Staples. Supplies for this printer are not cheap either. $120 for two rolls of paper? How am I saving money with this thing again?

Review.Titre: LX610 Printer Sucks!
Review.Contenu: LX610 worked amazing for a month.  Now all get is cutter errors with no support in the knowledge base.  I spend more time researching errors than I do actually printing labels.

Review.Titre: Not a waterproof label solution
Review.Contenu: We purchased the LX610 with plot cutter, specifically for the “oil and water resistant” label solution. Prior to purchase, we did our research and spoke to Primera and we’re assured this printer would work die our needs. Unfortunately the label stock does not hold up to any moisture whatsoever which is essential for our product. We have spent hours on the phone with tech support adjusting the ink and saturation, but it has made no difference. We were advised to purchase the clear lamination that was recently released, which we did. But, the lamination film does not work on labels with a white background. It shows every spec of dust/imperfection (maybe this is a better solution for full colour labels?). We’re feeling disappointed and frustrated - having invested $4k+ CDN and countless hours troubleshooting, but have no solution for our needs.

Review.Titre: What they don't tell you
Review.Contenu: Overall great printer, with some issues. The biggest issue is the ink is very expensive. The other issue is that the printer will not function if you run out of any single cartridge. They have intentionally placed a bug in the system that will intentionally only print a partial label when a cartridge is empty. Even if you switch the settings to monochrome black it will still not function properly (this is by their intentional design). During such cases the printer is a totally useless robot that intentionally prints improperly until you pay the outrageous price to have a single cartridge shipped to you and replace it. A week later and after much inconvienience you are good to go again. I have no complaints about reliability. I like the printer.

Review.Titre: Because I was shipping to a different…
Review.Contenu: Because I was shipping to a different place they canceled my order within 3 business days -- that is just too short. I placed my order on May 25th on May 26th (Thursday) -- they said I had to call by noon on Monday -- I called Monday but after noon their time and it was canceled. It also took forever to get the "bill to" different from the "ship to" ONLINE because it keep duplicating the ship to the bill to and the bill to to the ship to.  I finally placed my order through a nice person on the phone in SALES and it went through -- but you ONLINE is not good. We are also getting the machine because you stopped making the toner for a perfectly functioning machine we have. You product is good but the company servicing us needs serious improvement.

Review.Titre: The website is terrible
Review.Contenu: The website is terrible.  No mobile use as the Captcha totally interferes with screen operation.  I only needed ink and it was a Herculean task to give you business......

Review.Titre: Not sure they know their own products.
Review.Contenu: We were not only given the wrong information several times, but it seemed that no one at the company could agree on what label stock is used for what type of product. After being bounced around many times we were left with no answers. Our customer did not get labels in time for his wine bottles because the 'water proof' labels and inks/dyes were anything but. We purchased our primera printer primarily FOR wine labels and now it appears that it is not a good use for that - even though our rep told us this printer would work specifically for this.  We ended up going through a different vendor, and are now left wondering what to use the machine for.  The only reason they get 2 stars is because of them finally accepting the labels that they recommended to us back, and after going through some red tape, they also included the shipping of said product back.

Review.Titre: Sales process from the website is to be…
Review.Contenu: Sales process from the website is to be improved!!I had to place my order 3 times to get it right.Sales support (Pat) was very helpful. Thank you

Review.Titre: No communication
Review.Contenu: No communication. Snarky Customer Service Reps. Primarily interested in having the customer upgrade rather than solving the problem they were contacted for.

Review.Titre: Never got a reply to a shipping…
Review.Contenu: Never got a reply to a shipping question on a priority overnight order I placed. Why have email customer support if you're not going to answer them?

Review.Titre: Thought I was suppose to get the repair…
Review.Contenu: Thought I was suppose to get the repair for $350, I purchased an upgrade but could not ship the other machine for repair.  They charged me $450.

Review.Titre: Inflexible Shipping Policy Bites Again - The company policy to only use one…
Review.Contenu: The company policy to only use one shipper sunk this customer once again. This issue?  Only shipping FED EX to Hawaii - which adds $44-87 to the cost of ONE ink cartridge, making it impossible to enjoy my 910 printer as much as i'd like to.  Same shipping with USPS INSURED is $11.00 - oh and I added in 3 more cartridges. The individual employees who went the extra mile for me get 5 Stars, but again, they are hitting the company policy ceiling and will not be able to assist me again with this matter. Mahalo to both of you for getting my ink on it's way to me. Contrast this 2 day issue (and it's a repeat, we went thru this when I ordered the printer) to a response from Kenco asking if they'd mail inks and labels via USPS.  "Of Course!", they said.  "Just put a note in the comment section and it will flag it for personal attention.  Then you can use our USPS account or send the prepaid postage to us."  Guess who is getting all my ink and label business from now on?

Review.Titre: Shipping too high
Review.Contenu: Shipping is atrocious!  All I ordered was filters and the shipping was almost as much as the order!

Review.Titre: Wanted to see if a military discount…
Review.Contenu: Wanted to see if a military discount was offerded however revieved nothing for 20 yrs of service for my country. Sad!

Review.Titre: Was expecting more...
Review.Contenu: I upgraded my LX900 label printer to the new LX3000 as they are phasing out the LX900.  For a small business like ours, this was a big investment.  We ordered on Aug 14, 2021, and were told it would be a 1-2 week lead time which would be putting us in a tight position as we had several events coming up in Sept, mainly a beer can release on Sept 8th.  Apparently, there were issues and I was not made aware and we did not receive the printer until Sept 10th.  Then there was an issue with the Paypal credit payment (because it took so long Paypal put it on hold and then dropped it) and they threatened me with having to send the printer back if I did not pay.  Then to top it all off, one of the ink tanks did not have a chip on it so I could not use the printer.  I contacted them and instead of just sending me a new ink tank they made me send the other one back first.  Needless to say, I was out a label printer for 2 months during the busiest time of the year for our business.  The printer is up and working now and for that I am thankful, but Primera really needs to work on their customer service.  I was made to feel like it was all my fault.  We would never treat a customer like that and in fact would do everything to make it up to them.  It was a very frustrating experience.

Review.Titre: Not great
Review.Contenu: Terrible customer service. Products break easily from normal use. Great prices but not worth it.

Review.Titre: Way too slow
Review.Contenu: My Bravo II Primera 4100 is a great machine...when it is functioning properly.  But, that never happens for me.  When I use the PTPublisher, it takes anywhere from 2 minutes to 10 minutes to print each disc.  So, I always bypass it by using the Disc Cover 3 PE software.  Unfortunately, Primera locks the quantity of prints to 1.  So, I have to enter each print job, one at a time.  When you have 340 discs to print like i did last night, it can take a half hour to enter the print job.  But when you bust your butt to get a job done, then have to wait for the Primera print job, it can take 24-36 hours to print compared to manually getting it done in 4 hours.When you are manually loading jobs, you cannot use the PTPublisher's data to watch ink levels.  I have asked Primera why it takes so long to print and they just tell me the pauses are built in to let the system cool off or let programming respond to the next task.  I don't buy that, because it is very slow from the start.I have been manually entering 4000 disc per year, and it doesn't seem to overheat or have a problem with programming, printing a disc every 40-50 seconds, depending on the ink coverage (area printed).  If only they could give me a firmware to unlock the quantity of one limit, I would be totally satisfied and change my rating to 5.

Review.Titre: the choices of label stock are slim and…
Review.Contenu: the choices of label stock are slim and i cannot find any templates i need!

Review.Titre: He did not make an effort to understand…
Review.Contenu: He did not make an effort to understand my issue and offered one solution.

Review.Titre: Printer does a beautiful job - when its working!  Customer service less than stellar!
Review.Contenu: While my printer works fine - when it's working, I have been less than impressed with customer service, even after having the printer for a year.  It started with no assistance in using BarTender software and printer setup.  I had to teach myself how to setup and use that, then I've had glitches along the way and contacted customer support.  They are less than impressive and I get the feeling they are learning alongside with me.   They even had me go onto their website to download the manual for my printer only to find out that it was a broken link so he told me to just use a different printer model because "it's almost the same." Now my printer is in for repair because a label peeled off while printing and got jammed.  A jammed label = sending printer in for repair, folks!!  I was quoted 5-7 business days for the repair.  Today is DAY 9  and nobody will respond to me regarding the status of the repair.  Also interestingly enough, I placed a low rating earlier after my purchase regarding the customer service in the beginning and they begged me to remove or edit it.  I did not and quite honestly I am glad I didn't because they have continuously proved less than stellar in the customer service area.  Always say "they are working on the website" or "have new techs".  We get a lot of positive comments about our labels and packaging.  They are beautiful.  But when we are asked what printer we are using, I will tell them and will be honest about our customer service experiences.

Review.Titre: My issue is still not resolved
Review.Contenu: My issue is still not resolved. I can’t update to FW 1.45 on my LX500.

Review.Titre: Took 1 hour and 14 minutes to complete…
Review.Contenu: Took 1 hour and 14 minutes to complete my purchase.

Review.Titre: No customer retention plan, quirky printer
Review.Contenu: We have the Printer **, the spooler***** and the labeler *****.  The worst of the 3 is the printer.   very quirky.  Getting the label centered is hit and miss, the same label can print 100 times, and then all of a sudden be off the label. Also, the image will fade unexpectedly and you will have to abort and clean the print head - sometimes that works, sometimes it does not - the printer needs constant babysitting if you care about the quality of your labels.  Service is not real good, they have no loaner program and you have to send the printer in with no guarantee it will be fixed or how long they will have it.  Printer is 2 years old (bought it new), and already deemed obsolete by the vendor, some things just can't be fixed because the 2 year old printer is discontinued.  For this reason they get a 2 Star (should really be 1 star).  When it is working it is great, but the quirkiness is annoying and the repair is non existent.  When it fails we will replace with another vendor.  What would be great customer service in this case is an offer to give us some sort of credit/incentive to stay with the primera line.  But in the 2 years and the $10K + we have spent, not one offer or any type of communication has come our way - we discover the primera product strategy when the device fails and we have to call support - which I might add is not often (we deal with the quirky printer issues, primera can not fix them as it is not constant).  Oh, and did I mention the printer eats ink and it is not cheap.  The spooler and labeler have been error free in the last 2 years - they are great and hopefully will work with other printers.

Review.Contenu: I don’t like that I have been purchasing lots of ink in the past 3 years… you ask for a coupon code when I check out, yet I never received one :( doesn’t make me feel valued. Also I have hundreds of empty cartridges that I wished I could return to you for a recycling credit. :(((

Review.Titre: I'm on my 3rd LX610
Review.Contenu: I'm on my 3rd LX610, the 2nd Machine had problems right out of the box.  We are just now installing our 3rd LX610 and confidence in your refurbished products is running low. Factory Refurbished machines should be better then new, bugs worked out and faulty parts replaced, but you guys sent me a still broken printer.  Not happy with this product so far

Review.Titre: I suppose it's more of a quality issue
Review.Contenu: I suppose it's more of a quality issue. We purchased 2 new LX3000 printers this year. So far we have had to RMA the 2 original printers, plus one of the replacements that was sent to us. That's 3 total printers that have had failures. 2 of the printers leaked blue ink all over the place and made quite the mess on our floor and desk. Doing the RMA on the third replacement printers was also a frustrating experience dealing with customer service.Edit: Thank you for the prompt response and explanation.

Review.Titre: I have had to make too many adjustment…
Review.Contenu: I have had to make too many adjustment in order to get a good print.  I feel if I'm paying $3,000 for a machine I expect it to be ready for me to use and i shouldn't have to waste countess materials just to get the correct adjustments.   There is too much that needs to be done in order to achieve a good print. Theee should also be a specific video for Mac Users I have had to rely on Facebook groups and this shouldn't be the case.UpdateI am responding to the comment left by a staff member, I have taken the training and I still have to rely on Facebook groups and others in order to navigate through the printer.

Review.Titre: Great Machine, Defective Ink though!
Review.Contenu: I have enjoyed my edible printer greatly and it has been very straight forward to use! Only issue I have had is that the ink cartridge arriving with the printer stopped working properly with 90% remaining ink! Never heard back from customer support on the matter but had a spare I bought when ordering. I'm hoping the spare does not do the same as they are $130 Cartridges!

Review.Titre: Read reviews first!!
Review.Contenu: The printer is really neat, however it is not flawless which is unfortunate given the substantial investment. For the price of the machine and for some of the accessories, there should not be issues with parts on it being level. I purchased a new machine and used it for three weeks when I decided to install the platform kit that was an extra $80. I noticed the platform was not level and therefore the food items being printed on were not level causing images to be blurry on one side. Thinking it was the platform, I removed it to check. The platform was fine and is level but the arm that it attaches to is not. After receiving a second printer to hopefully resolve the issue, it disappointingly is not resolved. The new machine has the same issue. So, buyers should read reviews and think twice before paying extra for the platform kit because you will never get a clear image with a 3 mm difference in heights between the two sides. The same issue can be seen in the video on the website for the installation of the platform kit.

Review.Titre: We love our new labels…when it…
Review.Contenu: We love our new labels…when it works……the software/printer is not very user friendly.It’s easy to chat with support but, unfortunately it doesn’t always solve the problems we have.  I’m sure a lot of our issues are “user” related.  Just wish it was easier to navigate without having to call/chat.

Review.Titre: I am a long time customer of Primera
Review.Contenu: I am a long time customer of Primera. I try to keep extra ink on hand all the time so I placed an order for a set. The ink levels were fine and we are really busy with customers so I didn't realize the ink was never delivered. After we ran out of one color I contacted customer support and after several emails was told there policy is you only have 48 hours to report a non delivery and I have to eat $125.00 I paid for the ink. It doesn't seem like much to Primera but it is the lack of caring that really bothers me. It sad that some companies won't take the time or make even an effort at keeping 15 year customer.I am please with the response Primera Tier 2 has been most helpful and how quickly they responded. I appreciate the immediate correction of the problem and the help. Thank you

Review.Contenu: After leaving a #1 review I was contacted almost immediately by Primera as they had a voice mail issue and also were proactive in trying to help me solve my LX900 printer issue. Unfortunately I left town for 3 weeks and was not personally able to reconnect but I believe my son will contact Primera as soon as possible. For this effort I am changing my review to a #3 and if we are able to finally solve this problem I will upgrade the rating again to a #5.The chat line after 3 tries didn't help me determine my problem with the LX900 Color Label Printer. So I called twice to the customer service support line and in both cases after about 10-15 minutes the recording said sorry try some other time. So the second time it asked if I wanted a call back which I said yes and gave my phone number. After 3 days I am still waiting. I gave up and used a different printer. I have had good experience with my AP362 but cannot get this LX900 Printer do do anything. Ed Wagner

Review.Titre: Mediocre assistance at best

I’d really like this process to be more efficient. Additionally, associates often cop an attitude which drives me away from using Primera’s customer service altogether.

Review.Titre: My first LX 3000 stopped working at…
Review.Contenu: My first LX 3000 stopped working at about the time I changed ink cartridges for the first time.It was still under warranty. Anther was sent and worked great until the same thing happened soon after the ink cartridges were changed the first time. I would think they would know how to fix it because the same thing happened to the first one.Did you not figure out the problem when I sent it back?Now the third printer is a “reconditioned” LX3000. It’s now screwing up badly and I’m at wits end.I am out-of-town right now and could not take the he time to send it back to you and will have to deal with it when I get home on April 6.You sent a reconditioned printer.

Review.Titre: Label Feed and Alignment Problems
Review.Contenu: Ticket ID 122234; Here was the response: "Based on what you've explained, it would seem the Liner Drive Roller is worn on one side and to remedy the factors of that issue I would suggest to wrap a blank label around the Liner Idler Roller to increase the tension on the labels as they are being fed to prevent the misfeeding."Problem that I see is that if the above did not work, we still don't know what the problem is because hand wrapping a label onto the Label Idler Roller introduces variables that could go wrong. We decided to buy a new Liner Drive Roller.I did appreciate Sadike's quick response - that was most excellent.
